ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Have you been in treatment during the past 14 days? This means treatment at a program - do not count AA/NA or other self-help groups
Was your treatment at [NAME OF TREATMENT PROGRAM OF RECORD]?
If in treatment but not at the treatment program of record, what was the name of your treatment program?
How many days in the past 14 have you attended this treatment program?
Which of the following best describes the kind of program it was?
Notes: 1= Detox; 2= Abstinence-oriented rehab; 3= Dual disorder program; 4= Methadone maintenance

ElementDescription: Did you stay overnight at the program? If yes, which of the following best describes that program?
Notes: 1= Inpatient hospital; 2= Non-hospital residential; 3= Recovery home/halfway house; -8= Did not stay overnight

ElementDescription: If that program was an outpatient program, what were the recommended number of hours per week for that program?
Notes: 1= More than 20 hours/week; 2= 9-20 hours/week; 3= 2-9 hours/week; 4= Less than 2 hours/week; -8= Not an outpatient program

ElementDescription: What is your treatment status now?
Notes: 1= Out of treatment; 2= On wait list; 3= In treatment program of record; 4= In a different treatment program

The PROS (Personalized Recovery Oriented Services) staff is truly helping me take care of some problems in my life.
